section.title: Rough Cut Capacity Plan by Work Center
section.para: A Rough Cut Capacity Plan takes into account both planned and actual orders—and calculates the labor and machine Capacity required to fulfill the production Plan generated by MPS. This differs from a Capacity Plan, which only considers actual orders. To view a rough cut Capacity Plan by work center, select the Rough Cut Capacity Plan by Work Center option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Rough Cut Capacity Plan by Work Center

section.para: When displaying a rough cut Capacity Plan by work center, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify which work centers you want to include in the display:
Select to display rough cut Capacity Plan by work center for all work centers.
Specify work center whose rough cut Capacity Plan you want to display.
Select if you want to include tooling capacity information in the display. The following options are available:
Select to include capacity information about all tooling items in the display.
Specify tooling item whose capacity information you want to include in the display.
Select to display rough cut Capacity Plan by work center for all sites.
Specify site whose rough cut Capacity Plan by work center you want to display.
Planned and actual orders started on or after this date will be displayed. Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed.
Planned and actual orders ending on or before this date will be displayed. Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed.
Display lists rough cut Capacity Plan by work center, using the specified parameters.
